TEI.2.document_title: John G. Purnell to Richard Fields, 10-04-1825

barker_notes.barker_summary: Exhorts Fields to remain at peace with Mexican nation and American settlers.

*div1 type="summary"* *p*Exhorts Fields to remain at peace with Mexican nation and American settlers.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Saltillo*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="10-04-1825">October 4th. 1825*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*To *person_mentioned*Captain Richard Fields*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Commander of the Cherokees in *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned**/p* *p*My esteemed friend When last I saw you in my *location_mentioned*house */location_mentioned*in *location_mentioned*Monterrey*/location_mentioned* I little thought in so short a time you would have commenced a war against your *person_mentioned*American brothers*/person_mentioned* and the *person_mentioned*Mexican Nation*/person_mentioned* more particularly A man like yourself who is acquainted with the advantages of civilization and who joined us in our late war as a *person_mentioned*brother*/person_mentioned* against the *person_mentioned*Brittish nation*/person_mentioned* nothing like personal motives should ever induce you to commit an act which will ultimately injure you in the estimation of your *person_mentioned*American brothers*/person_mentioned* much less lead your *person_mentioned*nation*/person_mentioned* into a war which will render them unhappy: dreadful may be the consequences if you continue in such mistaken measures as a *person_mentioned*friend */person_mentioned*I advise you to look for peace as the surest means of making the *location_mentioned*nation */location_mentioned*happy who have confided in you by electing you their *person_mentioned*chief*/person_mentioned*, we all wish to live with you like *person_mentioned*brothers */person_mentioned*you know we have never deceived you it is not by maddening war that we are to progress in civilation or the comforts of life it is by a firm and lasting peace by a friendly intercourse like that which exists between *person_mentioned*brothers*/person_mentioned*. If your claims for *location_mentioned*lands */location_mentioned*were not granted at a time when the *person_mentioned*Government */person_mentioned*was not firmly established that should not be a cause of war ask and it will [be] given to you this *location_mentioned*nation */location_mentioned*has always felt friendly inclined toward yours and I am sure if you cease hostilities they will enter into a treaty with you by which you will obtain more permanent advantages than you can by being at war. listen to advice of your *person_mentioned*friend */person_mentioned*who ansciously looks for the prosperity and happiness of yourself and nation let us bury the hatchet smoke the pipe of peace and live like *person_mentioned*brothers */person_mentioned*then will the great *person_mentioned*Mexican nation*/person_mentioned* offer you the arm and protection of Government: take these important considerations into deep reflection in your *person_mentioned*councils */person_mentioned*let not personal prejudices act upon you but that you may be governed by prudence wisdom and friendship is the sincere wish of your old friend and Obedient Humble Servant*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*JOHN G. PURNELL*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*/div1*
